action.action-desc: Mr. Mitchell introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make permanent certain provisions of Public Law 115–97, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Tax Cuts and Jobs Middle Class Enhancement Act.

section.header: Exclusion of 2018 bonuses from gross income

subsection.text: Gross income shall not include amounts received by an individual as a bonus after December 22, 2017, and before January 1, 2019.
The amount of gain excluded from gross income under subsection (a) with respect to an individual shall not exceed $5,000.
For purposes of this section, the term bonus means amounts paid to an employee other than amounts obligated under an employment contract.

section.header: Certain provisions of Public Law 115–97 made permanent
section.text: Any provision of subtitle A or B of Public Law 115–97, or any amendment made by such a provision, that terminates on December 31, 2025, shall not terminate on such date.

subsection.text: Section 63(c)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking and at the end of clause (i), by striking $12,000 in clause (ii) and inserting $13,000, by striking the period at the end of clause (ii) and inserting , and, and by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: by substituting $26,000 for 200 percent of the dollar amount in effect under subparagraph (C) for the taxable year

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(ii), by striking the $18,000 and $12,000 amounts and inserting the dollar amounts.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect as if included in the enactment of section 11021 of Public Law 115–97.

subsection.text: Section 24 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—
